title: Aurora australis seen across Australia as geomagnetic storms deliver light show | ABC NEWS
description: An impressive aurora australis has been seen in many parts of Australia, reportedly reaching as far north as Hamilton Island in Queensland.   Tuesday night's light show was caused by a severe solar storm hitting the Earth. title: Trump withdraws tariff threat, spruiks future Greenland deal | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump says a framework for a future Greenland deal has been reached as he confirmed Washington will not proceed with extra tariffs on EU members which opposed his bid to seize the Arctic island. The US leader hailed the proposed deal as a great solution for the United States and NATO despite having earlier insisted the US had annex Greenland. A potential trade war between the US and the European Union is likely to have been averted after several European leaders weighed retaliatory tariffs dubbed trade bazookas.  Donald Trump also met with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum. title: Life for a Bondi survivor weeks after the attack | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Jessica Chapnik Kahn was there at Bondi on December 14th, shielding her daughter as shots were fired into a Jewish festival, killing 15 people.   More than a month later, she’s trying to find a way to live with what she went through and she says it's her heart that’s guiding her.   Today, on this National Day of Mourning for the victims of the Bondi Beach terrorist attack, we hear Jessica’s story and speak with Michael Visontay, a Sydney resident and commissioning editor of the Jewish Independent, about how the community is dealing with the aftermath of tragedy and the fractious political debate.     Featured:   Jessica Chapnik Kahn, Bondi survivor   Michael Visontay, The Jewish Independent commissioning editor

title: Prince Harry says tabloids made his wife Meghan's life 'a misery' at Daily Mail trial | ABC NEWS
description: Prince Harry has given evidence against the publisher of The Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday, alleging they used illegal spy tactics to access sensitive information for stories.  The Duke of Sussex told a court the life of his wife, the Duchess of Sussex, was made 'a misery.' The Duke of Sussex and six other claimants, including singer Elton John, are suing Associated Newspapers Limited for privacy violations from the early 1990s until the 2010s. description: Bondi lifeguard Jackson Doolan was one of the first on the scene of the Bondi Terror Attack. description: The National party has broken up the Coalition for a second time in less than a year. title: Palestinian reporters, two 13yo boys killed by Israel in Gaza | ABC NEWS
description: The Palestinian Health authority says three Palestinian journalists have been killed by a Israeli strike in Gaza. The journalists were travelling in a vehicle provided by the Egyptian Committee, which supervises Egypt's relief work in Gaza.   Commenting on the incident involving the journalists, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said troops identified "several suspects who operated a drone affiliated with Hamas" in central Gaza. The reporters' deaths were among 11 reported by the Palestinian Health Authority. Two 13-year-old boys were also killed by Israeli forces. title: December's surprise unemployment drop shows strength of economy | ABC NEWS
description: The unemployment rate declined sharply from 4.3 to 4.1 per cent in December.  The better-than-expected figures are attributable to an injection of 62,500 new positions created in the month, most of which were full-time roles.  KPMG Chief Economist Brendan Rynne says the encouraging data reflects the maintained strength of the Australian economy but suggests a wait-and-see approach for the Reserve Bank's next rates decision. title: Several missing after landslide hits New Zealand campground | ABC NEWS
description: Several people including children are missing after a landslide struck a camping site in New Zealand’s North Island.  Cars, tents, campervans, a toilet-and-shower block were swept away in the incident at Mount Maunganui.  Fire and Emergency New Zealand says the situation is complex, as search and rescue teams scramble to search for anyone trapped at the Beachside Holiday Park. title: Europe's hard line on Greenland has 'shaken' Trump's confidence: expert | ABC NEWS
description: Dr Stuart Rollo from the University of Sydney says Donald Trump applied his characteristic 'maximalist' position with regards to Greenland and his European allies pushed back leading to what appears to be a back down. However, Dr Rollo says the US President and his administration are determined to exert more control over the Arctic territory.
